page.title: 14Children's Games 2 (Pembrey)
page.content: { Starting a game { }Ibble!Obble! Black,bobble, Ibble!Obble!Out! All the children stand in a ring and put one foot out. Then the child who sings the rhyme touches every foot while singing the rhyme. The foot touched when "Out!" is said, leaves the ring. This is repeated until one is left and that child is "On it". {Off to London} This is a chasing game. The person on it turns his back on the others. The rest of the children stand in a straight line and wait for him to say "Off to London 123". On hearing these words the children run up to the one who's on it. When he turns round they all stop. If someone moves he goes back to the start, the others continue the game until one touches the caller.
